name: All-Devouring Narwhal
desc:
Cryptic Creature: All-Devouring Narwhal

In the most fantastical of fables, or perhaps in the most rabid of ravings, the true stars in the depths of cosmos are just as full of life as on Teyvat, while the universe itself is akin to an ocean.

Perhaps the universe's infiltration of Teyvat has never ceased, and perhaps the drawing of borders around this world was the work of a higher will, meant to protect it.

customize.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
customize.desc:

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Friendly Fracas - All-Devouring Narwhal's Cruise

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow." "Most cats are afraid of falling into any water, never mind the great lakes or the ocean. And the leviathans lurking in the depths... Knowledge of their existence alone would make them turn tail and flee on the spot."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: This opponent engages in a Duel with you rather than an Adventure Challenge. The All-Devouring Narwhal is immune to Frozen, Stun, and Petrification, and starts with the Talent Card "Lightless Feeding" equipped. It will also Discard 1 card from its Hand at the start of each Round.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.name: Lightless Feeding
customize.desc:
All-Devouring Narwhal: Lightless Feeding

Phosphorescent creatures float all about the dark, moonless seas of dreams — perhaps they are as food for some titanic leviathan.

customize.text: <color=#ffffffd9>Achieve victory with characters defeated less than twice during the battle</color>

customize.name: Lightless Feeding
customize.desc:
All-Devouring Narwhal: Lightless Feeding

Phosphorescent creatures float all about the dark, moonless seas of dreams — perhaps they are as food for some titanic leviathan.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Serious Showdown - All-Devouring Narwhal's Cry

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow..." "Fairy tales and folk legends all chronicle that the world has a space wider and darker than even the sea at night. In that realm, there might live beings even larger and scarier than the king of Blubberbeasts..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: This opponent engages in a Duel with you rather than an Adventure Challenge. The All-Devouring Narwhal is immune to Frozen, Stun, and Petrification, and starts with the Talent Card "Lightless Feeding" equipped. It will also Discard 2 cards from its Hand at the start of each Round, heal itself for 1 HP, and draw 1 card.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

In the most fantastical of fables, or perhaps in the most rabid of ravings, the true stars in the depths of cosmos are just as full of life as on Teyvat, while the universe itself is akin to an ocean.

Perhaps the universe's infiltration of Teyvat has never ceased, and perhaps the drawing of borders around this world was the work of a higher will, meant to protect it.

value.text: Reward for accepting the Tavern Challenge at The Cat's Tail and claiming victory in a Friendly Fracas with the All-Devouring Narwhal

value.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
value.desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Deals 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> . This character deals +1 DMG for every 3 additional max HP provided by <color=#ffffff>Insatiable Appetite</color> (Max +4.) After this, <color=#ffffff>Discard</color> 1 card from your Hand with the highest original Elemental Dice Cost.

<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
Deals 1 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> , deals 1 <color=#ffffff>Piercing DMG</color> to all opposing characters on standby. Summons 1 <color=#ffffff>Dark Shadow</color> .

<color=#ffd780>Passive Skill</color>
(Passive) When battle begins, create 1 <color=#ffffff>Deep Devourer's Domain</color> .
<color=#ece5d8>Deep Devourer's Domain</color>
<color=#ffd780>Combat Status</color>
Cards you have <color=#ffffff>Discard</color> ed or used for <color=#ffffff>Tune</color> will be consumed.
<color=#ffffff>For every 3 cards consumed</color> , the All-Devouring Narwhal gains 1 extra Max HP. If there are at least 2 Cards amongst these that have the same original Elemental Dice Cost, gain another 1 extra Max HP. If all 3 Cards have the same original Elemental Dice Cost, gain yet another 1 extra Max HP.

<color=#ffd780>Summon</color>
<color=#ffffff>When played:</color> Gain "Attack Power" equal to the Elemental Dice Cost of the devoured card with the highest Cost, and gain <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> based on the number of devoured Cards with said Cost.
<color=#ffffff>End Phase and when you declare the end of your Round:</color> Deals <color=#ffacff>Electro DMG</color> equal to "Attack Power."
<color=#ffffff>When your active character takes DMG:</color> Reduce DMG taken by 1, then this card's <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> -2.

Applies Hydro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Vaporize</color> : DMG +2 for this instance
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Electro-Charged</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> <color=#ffffff>] Frozen</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, the target is unable to perform any Actions this Round (Can be removed in advance after the target receives +2 Physical or Pyro DMG)
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Bloom</color> : DMG+1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Dendro Core</color> ] that grants +2 DMG to the next instance of Pyro or Electro DMG

Applies Electro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Overloaded</color> : DMG +2 for this instance, the target is forcibly switched to the next character
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Superconduct</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Electro-Charged</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Quicken</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Catalyzing Field</color> ] that grants +1 DMG to the next 2 instances of Dendro or Electro DMG

<color=#ece5d8>Physical DMG</color>
Physical DMG will not apply any Elements, nor can it engage in Elemental Reactions.
<color=#ece5d8>Discard</color>
Use Action Cards or Character Skill effects to Discard Action Cards from Hand or Deck.
<color=#ece5d8>Usage(s)</color>
After this card's effect is triggered, 1 <color=#ffffff>Usage</color> of it will be consumed.
This card will be discarded immediately once it has 0 <color=#ffffff>Usages</color> remaining.
<color=#ece5d8>Piercing DMG</color>
Piercing DMG cannot be increased by any bonuses, but cannot be defended against using Shields or DMG Immunity either.
<color=#ece5d8>Tune</color>
Discard Action Cards from Hand to initiate Elemental Tuning
